page.title: 17Village of Hooton Roberts
page.content: This small village consists of old stone cottages and barns converted into residential homes, is situated in a rural setting on the main A630 between Rotherham and Doncaster. The close knit community of approximately 100 families, many of which have close connections with the land. Arable farming is the mainstay although 30 or so beef cattle are reared for market. The old stone church and community hall are centres for social gatherings: barn dances, barbecues and parish meetings. The Manor House was recently converted into the village's only public house, hotel and restaurant. The small Post Office acts as the local shop but only for the basic essentials. Other provisions must be bought ftom nearby towns. Children travel to school in the surrounding area by scheduled bus.
